title: Gym & Tonic: Marketing site + Account + Tonic Access Pass (frontend)

requirements.summary: Build an English marketing experience describing the Gym & Tonic concept, workout styles, holistic positioning, and the membership-inclusive Tonic cafe access.
acceptanceCriteria: A visitor can navigate to sections/pages that describe: workout offerings (weights/calisthenics/rowing-cardio), holistic fitness positioning, and the “Tonic” cafe concept.
The site uses consistent brand naming: “Gym & Tonic” for the overall business and “Tonic” for the cafe.
All copy is in English and is readable on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Create the main app shell as a small marketing site with navigable sections (concept, workout styles, holistic outlook, and Tonic cafe access) and consistent English copy; include top navigation and responsive section layouts.
Ensure the document title and basic metadata align with the “Gym & Tonic” brand and that the page is configured for good mobile readability.

requirements.summary: Add Internet Identity sign-in and an Account area that shows membership status and Tonic access entitlement, with a sign-in prompt when signed out.
acceptanceCriteria: A user can sign in via Internet Identity and see an Account page/section.
The Account view clearly displays a membership status (e.g., Active/Inactive) and a “Tonic Access” indicator (Included/Not included).
Signed-out users see a clear call-to-action to sign in.

file_operations.description: Create a login/logout button using the selected authorization component’s frontend approach (useInternetIdentity + query cache clearing on logout). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a React Query hook that uses useActor() to fetch getCallerMemberState() and expose loading/error states for Account/Pass UI.

Add a React Query hook for getCallerUserProfile() following the selected authorization component guidance to prevent profile-setup flash. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create an Account section that: (1) prompts signed-out users to sign in, (2) for signed-in users shows membership status + Tonic Access, and (3) requests a first-time display name via saveCallerUserProfile() as per the selected authorization component guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the Account section into the marketing site navigation and render it as a dedicated section/page area; include LoginButton placement and ensure signed-out prompt is visible.

requirements.summary: Provide a signed-in “Tonic Access Pass” screen that displays cafe name, user identifier, membership state, and access granted/not granted indicator.
acceptanceCriteria: For an active member with Tonic access, the pass shows “Access: Granted”.
For a non-member (or inactive member), the pass shows “Access: Not granted”.
The pass screen is usable on a phone-sized viewport without horizontal scrolling.

file_operations.description: Create a phone-friendly access pass view that shows: “Tonic”, a user identifier (prefer profile name; optionally include a shortened principal), membership state, and “Access: Granted/Not granted” derived from getCallerMemberState(); show sign-in CTA if signed out.
Wire the Tonic Access Pass into the main navigation and ensure it is reachable as a distinct section/page area (without horizontal scrolling on small viewports).

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive modern fitness-cafe theme with consistent typography/spacing and a primary palette that is not blue/purple-dominant.
acceptanceCriteria: A single, consistent theme is applied across the app (colors, typography, components).
Primary palette does not use blue/purple as the dominant brand color.
Pages/sections share consistent layout rhythm (headings, section spacing, buttons/links).

file_operations.description: Define global theme tokens (CSS variables used by Tailwind/shadcn styling) and base typography/spacing rules using a warm/neutral/energy palette (e.g., charcoal + off-white + citrus/amber accents) that avoids blue/purple as primary.

Adjust/extend Tailwind theme settings as needed to support the Gym & Tonic brand theme (typography scale, spacing rhythm, shadows), ensuring the primary color mapping corresponds to the non-blue/purple palette.
Create a small reusable section wrapper to enforce consistent layout rhythm (heading styles, max width, vertical spacing) across marketing, Account, and Pass sections.
Adopt the shared section/layout primitives so all site areas follow consistent UI patterns (buttons/links, headings, spacing).

requirements.summary: Add and display the generated logo/hero/icons as static frontend assets within the marketing experience (no backend image serving).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
At least the hero image and logo are visible on the landing experience.
No backend endpoint is used to serve these static images.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static logo asset at the required path for direct frontend usage.
Add the generated wide hero banner asset at the required path for direct frontend usage.
Add the generated monochrome icon set asset at the required path for direct frontend usage.

Create a hero/branding component that directly references frontend/public/assets/generated/gym-tonic-hero.dim_1600x900.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/gym-tonic-logo.dim_512x512.png (no backend routing).

Create a workout styles section (weights, calisthenics, rowing/cardio) and visually incorporate the static icon sheet at frontend/public/assets/generated/gym-tonic-icons.dim_512x512.png for the four icons.
Wire Hero and WorkoutStyles into the landing/marketing flow so the hero image and logo are visible on initial load and icons support the workout offerings section.
